extendedInfo.description: FLIR Tools Mobile is an intuitive Android app for analyzing, managing, and distributing infrared images. Using FLIR Tools Mobile, you can do the following:- Remote control- MSX- Images with sketch on DC and IR - Images with field of view follow- Editable text comments- Emissivity table- Import images from your Wi-Fi-enabled infrared camera.- Lay out and move measurement tools on the image.- Read out temperature measurements.- Zoom in on images.- On the Android phone, remotely take snapshots when a camera is connected.- On the camera, take snapshots that will automatically be saved on the Android phone.- Delete images on the Android phone.- Display an imageâs GPS coordinates on Google Maps.- Create and e-mail reports.- Save images in the Android phone photo library. - Send images to FTP sites and other file-sharing services (Dropbox, Box.net, etc.). - Display image information, e.g., object parameters, text comments, and file details.- Play back voice comments.- Change the level and span. - Change general settings in the app.- Change the palette.

reviews.title: FLIR Tools
reviews.comment: Finally figured out how to set up the hot-spot, and then configure the network for the camera.  I use a droid3 Motorola phone running the FLIR Tools software, but could not get the camera to connect when I had the hot spot running. I read the help files and didn\'t find a solution so I tried a different approach. I have a Nexus7 and down loaded the FLIR Tools software onto the Nexus7.   With my phone running the hot-spot, and the software running on my Nexus7, the FLIR camera is now visible & connected.
reviews.author: Kendall Gould

reviews.title: Hussan
reviews.comment: How do I get it to edit the report format, or add notes and other text to the report. Can some one please guide me?
reviews.author: Hussan Syedzada Saeed

reviews.title: What?
reviews.comment: I thought it would use the phones Camra!  So dumb that you have to connect to u wifi network and find a Camra what. What am I sapost to do if I can\'t find one? Then the app is useless! Uninstalled !
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great Improvement
reviews.comment: New version is awesome!  You must have a FLIR camera but if you are going to buy a thermal imager, FLIR is by far the best choice.  If you have an E60 or higher, you can stream wirelessly.  If you don\'t own a FLIR camera you really don\'t have a need to download this as it will only frustrate you if you expect it to work with anything other than a FLIR camera.  If you own a FLIR camera, this is a fantastic must have app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Does Not Work On My Phone- HTC Amaze and T-Mobile
reviews.comment: Firstly, I have a FLIR thermal imager and I understand what this app is supposed to do. It does NOT turn your camera phone into a thermal imager.    If I establish the WiFi hotspot on my phone, the phone recognizes the FLIR camera as an authorized user. The FLIR camera recognizes the phone in the list of networks. If the settings were incorrect, the two devices would not see each other.    When I launch the app in the above configuration, I get an error message that there is no WiFi connection.    If the FLIR camera is connected to my secure home WiFi network, and the phone is connected to the same home network (NOT hotspot), then the FLIR app works.    As it is described, this app is supposed to allow a direct wireless connection between the Android phone and the FLIR camera. If this is the case, then it does not work using a HTC Amaze on the T-Mobile USA network.    I do not know if the T-Mobile network is stopping the FLIR camera because I do not have a tethering plan. The FLIR camera is not attempting internet access, so I should not need a tethering plan. I have emailed the developer about this.    If something changes, I\'ll update my review.
reviews.author: A Google User
